org.finra.jtaf.ewd

Interface ExtWebDriver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultExtWebDriver

    public interface ExtWebDriver
extends org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver
    ExtWebDriver provides extensions to the WebDriver API to support the widget framework and permit changes to the implementing configuration

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ExtWebDriver.StaleWindowIdListException
      StaleWindowIdListException will be thrown when the stored window ids cannot be usefully compared with the current window ids

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver

        org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.ImeHandler, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Navigation, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Options, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.TargetLocator, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Timeouts, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.Window

        Configures the use of JavaScript for entry of input fields, rather than relying on the native WebDriver methods
        Parameters:
        useJavaScript - true to enable the use of JavaScript, default is false

        Opens the browser

      • back

        void back()
        Simulates browser Back button

      • closeCurrentBrowser

        void closeCurrentBrowser()
        Closes the browser window, but does not kill IEDriverServer.exe, use this if you changed browsers mid-session and want to close the window. if you are using IEDriverServer.exe to run your tests you must use close() if you are done with the WebDriver session or execution will hang.
        See Also:
        WebDriver.close()

      • forward

        void forward()
        Simulates browser Forward button

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        Reloads the current URL

      • storeCurrentWindowIds

        void storeCurrentWindowIds()
        Stores handles for all existing windows for later comparison
        See Also:
        selectPopupWindow()

      • focus

        void focus()
        Request focus for the active window with the current WebDriver

      • selectWindow

        void selectWindow(java.lang.String windowId)
        Sets the active window for the current WebDriver
        Parameters:
        windowId - the window id string

      • selectPopupWindow

        java.lang.String selectPopupWindow()
                                   throws ExtWebDriver.StaleWindowIdListException
        Sets the most recently opened browser window as the active windwo for the current WebDriver. Assumes that storeCurrentWindowIds() was called before the window opened and that only one window has opened since.
        Returns:
        the Id of the newly opened window
        Throws:
        ExtWebDriver.StaleWindowIdListException - when the difference between the stored window ids and the current window ids is more than one window

      • getAllWindowIds

        java.lang.String[] getAllWindowIds()
        Retrieves the windowHandle IDs
        Returns:
        array of current window ids

      • getWindowId

        java.lang.String getWindowId()
        Returns the current window handle ID
        Returns:
        the window Id for the active window for the webdriver

      • currentWindowMaximize

        void currentWindowMaximize()
        Maximizes the current browser window

      • verifyAlert

        @Deprecated
void verifyAlert()
        Deprecated. as it is a one off and no corresponding methods exist for other alert dialogs
        Method designed to throw an runtime exception if no alert exists

        Returns the original HTML source of the current frame

      • getGeneratedHtmlSource

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getGeneratedHtmlSource()
        Retrieves current state of the DOM in HTML format for each of the document's frames.
        Returns:
        A map of HTMLs. Each key describes the location of the FRAME relative to the root DOM. The value is the HTML associated with the key. A key example is FRAME[root-2-1], which identifies the IFRAME that is the 1st IFRAME found underneath the 2nd IFRAME underneath the root DOM.

      • selectFrame

        void selectFrame(java.lang.String locator)
        Selects a new frame from within the current frame
        Parameters:
        locator - XPath, ID, name, CSS Selector, class name, or tag name

      • selectFrameByNameOrId

        @Deprecated
void selectFrameByNameOrId(java.lang.String nameOrId)
        Deprecated. the basic select frame should accept all locators which include name or id
        Selects a frame by the its name or id
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the name or id to select by

      • unselectFrame

      • evaluateXpath

        java.lang.String evaluateXpath(java.lang.String XPath)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Evaluates an XPath in JavaScript to return a string value based on the resulting node(s) or XPath function results
        Parameters:
        XPath - the XPath to evaluate
        Returns:
        the string value representing the XPath
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the evaluation of the XPath fails
